SENT.plain: AIM: We present a novel, previously undescribed technique of obtaining a biopsy from an inaccessible parapharyngeal space mass
METHOD: A modified endo-cavitary ultrasound probe was utilised to obtain an intra-oral, image-guided core biopsy of a parapharyngeal tumour
The parapharyngeal mass was not accessible to percutaneous ultrasound-guided biopsy due to its anatomical location
CONCLUSION: To our knowledge, this is the first such modification of the conventional endo-cavitary probe technique described in the literature
The technique permits accurate, well controlled biopsy of lesions located high in the parapharyngeal space, under general anaesthesia
